User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101203 Firefox/3.6.13
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101207 Mnenhy/0.8.3 Thunderbird/3.1.7

SaveAs allows saving an individual message as .eml, text, or HTML. Selecting multiple messages allows saving them as .eml files.  I want to be able to select multiple messages and then save them all at once as text or HTML files.  An extension called SmartSave supposedly does this but is incompatible with my version of Thunderbird.  This functionality should be integrated with Thunderbird anyway, so it is not dependent on extensions.

In the bug 364445 report, he wants to save multiple messages into a single file, so please don't mark this bug report as a duplicate of that.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Highlight a message.
2.Highlight one or more additional messages using shift- or control- click.
3.Click File > Save As > File.  Select a folder and click OK.
Actual Results:  
The files are saved in the .eml format.

Expected Results:  
A dialog box with a drop-down menu prompting to save as either .eml, .txt, or HTML.
